intro: Caucalis infesta var. elatior, commonly known as the greater caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters that attract various pollinators.
